column4: Anything else I need to do besides modifying the laptop-mode.conf?
make sure sleep is enabled.... blah blah
I would assume that a restart is needed...and it's only 1 am here...
that's the easiest way, yeah
no effect. backlight remains lit, though screen is otherwise blank. I need it to turn the backlight off.
put the contents of the two files I suggested that you modify into pastebin.ca
I mentioned /etc/default/acpi-support
which one
Finally got the acpi-support file open (read only). What line should I be looking for? <--repeaded
did you get my message to paste the contents of THAT file and laptop[...] .conf file into pastebin.ca?
and why can you only get it to open read-only?  you'll need to do chmod o+w /etc/defaults/apci-support (or something like that)
http://pastebin.ca/204808 <--laptop-mode.conf | http://pastebin.ca/204810 <--acpi-support
your acpi-support file isn't there
my bad
it should be there...

in laptop file:  ENABLE_LAPTOP_MODE_ON_AC=1   in ACPI file: uncomment this line:  ACPI_SLEEP=true and ENABLE_LAPTOP_MODE=true (if you have problems, then put ENABLE_LAPTOP_MODE back to false and try again)
k, I'll try that.
no joy, it's still not doing what I want...
does sleep work at all?
but doesn't work when the lid is closed, is that the only issue at this point?
wasn't having a problem with Sleep/Hibernate.
